alert.note: Alert for Clay; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Talladega, south central St. Clair and central Clay Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Alpine Bay Resort to near Ashland. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Pell City, Lineville, Ashland, Vincent, Waldo, Alpine Bay Resort, Winterboro, Alpine, Coosa Island, Logan Martin Dam, Barfield, Logan Martin Lake, Country Club Estates, Chandler Springs, Ironaton, Millerville, Howells Cove and Gunthertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
